intro: Coussapoa longipedunculata, commonly known as the long peduncle cupuaçu, is a species of the Malvaceae family native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters along long peduncles. The plant produces a fruit that is similar to the cacao pod, containing edible seeds surrounded by a sweet, mucilaginous pulp. It thrives in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soils and requires ample sunlight. Due to its unique botanical features and potential economic value, it is of interest to botanists and agricultural researchers.
